Home.Statement: Pressta is San Francisco's premiere engineering, design and manufacturing facility specializing in R&D, prototyping and assembly.

Services.Design: Our skilled designers are some of the best in the business. They can help any stage of the process from turning your concept into a reality or applying that final polish.
Services.Engineering: We will work with you to make sure your project is completed in-spec and on time. We have an extensive background designing products for B2B and consumer use
Services.Manufacturing: We are able to machine most materials, including; steel, stainless steel, aluminum and plastics.

BottomCards.AdvancedMachinery: We use modern high speed machining strategies to turn jobs around quicker than the competition.
BottomCards.OnTimeEverytime: Pressta MFG’s combined 21 years of experience in metalworking and fabrication helps keep projects on track and allows us to foresee potential issues before they come up.
BottomCards.SkilledExperts: Our comprehensive background allows us to offer more services in-house saving you time and money by preventing delays and expensive reworks.
BottomCards.FulfillingYourNeeds: Our engineering expertise allows us to turn your idea into a finished product and reproduce / repair pieces which are no longer in production.

Design.Statement: filler filler text yo, filler filler text

Engineering.Statement: We specialize in design for manufacture / servicability and top of the line analysis.

Manufacturing.Statement: We specialize in CNC machined parts, gaskets and welded assemblies

Services.Machining: We can produce turned and milled parts using our in-house engine lathe and CNC
Services.Printing: We have both SLA and FDM 3D printers to quickly prototype plastic components.
Services.LaserCutting: We frequently use laser cutting to produce gaskets and stencils/graphics.
Services.Welding: We use TIG and MIG welding to join complex assemblies and perform repairs to existing components

Other: Mirror Polishing (Non-Directional with a very high degree of image clarity, typically 0.05 µm Ra or less. Sample may be required)
